content: Here, Algeria was expressing a concern of all developing states, because the effects of a freely floating system, and reliance on US dollar as international reserve, were especially bad for them. The freely floating system had effectively come into play as the default posittion, something that US negotiators used to their advantage, by claiming that they much preferred doing nothing and allowing a system of floating rates. When even France and Germany decided to float, it was now up to the leaders whose states would be most severely effected by the breakdown in negotiations. See: Stephany Griffith-Jones, and Jose A. Ocampo. "Compensatory financing for shocks: what changes are needed?." (2008).
